frontmatter.title: Zero-Copy. Transfer Data Faster In Ruby
frontmatter.description: In this post I will explain the concept behind zero-copy, which is feature of the Linux allowing for faster transfer of data between pipes, file-descriptors and sockets. I will demonstrate how you can use this functionality in your Ruby projects using a code example. This functionality has been implemented in C, Java, Ruby, Perl and nameless other languages, but in this blog I will focus on the Ruby usage.
